course.subject: UROP
course.name: Undergraduate Research Opportunities Series 2
course.description: This is the second course of the three-course series developed under the Undergraduate Research Opportunities Program (UROP). The series enables a student to complete a faculty-led research project that can possibly span three terms. Enrollment in UROP 2100 requires successful completion of UROP 1100 of the same project. UROP 2100 may be repeated for credit under a different project which has been successfully completed at the UROP 1100 level. Approval by faculty supervisor(s) is required. Students are required to submit a written report upon completion of the course. Students with approval by supervising faculty may continue in the project series. Graded P or F.

reviews.author: qwertyyuiop
reviews.title: Good opportunity to learn cutting-edge knowledge
reviews.comment_content: The content is just the same as descriptions on the webpage. But in detail, professor will assign a PHD or Master student to supervise your work, so your work is highly dependent on the actual supervisor.
reviews.comment_teaching:
To contribute your work, you are supposed to read papers first. And you are asked to implement or improve some features of the whole project.

There should be a weekly meeting with the student who supervises you. If your work is enough advanced, you will have weekly meeting with the professor as a team member of the student who supervises you. They are mostly helpful and kind.
reviews.comment_grading: If you did not free-ride through the project, you will definitly pass this course, and professor will invite you to go on to the next stage.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is highly dependent on your work and your will to learn. You can either do the basic stuff of your part, or learn lots of knowledge and make an excellent one. But if you prefer staying in this project in the next semesters, you are strongly suggested to do more, since this can reduce your workload in the future.
